pullRequest.title: Update rest API specs
pullRequest.bodyText:
This commit updates the rest API specs to validate against a JSON schema for the specifications. Most updates are to add a description, whilst others fix typos and unify conventions e.g. deprecations, descriptions, urls starting with /.
/cc @elastic/es-clients

commit.message:
Update rest API specs

This commit updates the rest API specs to validate against a
JSON schema for the specifications. Most updates are to add
a description, whilst others fix typos and unify conventions
e.g. deprecations, descriptions, urls starting with /.

Add JSON schema for rest api specs

This commit adds a JSON schema for rest api specs.
The schema conforms to draft-07 schema.

nodes.bodyText:
Can we include this as part of the work to make the validation happen in gradle?
Feel its better to discuss this on that PR.

curious to why draft-07 and not 2019-09 (formerly draft-08) ?
I think the difference here would be mostly cosmetic, so probably not a big deal either way. just curious if there was a specific reason ?
I think we should we be stricter here for the Major.minor.patch versioning.  (e.g. require patch and not allow qualifiers) Devs should know the exact version the code is first shipping with.
should we expand this to an array to allow saying this was deprecrated in 6.8.7 and 7.6.1 ? (probably not with this PR, but as a follow up)

I wonder if we should leave this out and set additionalProperties to true ?
.. or if we should find where this is used and make it an external definition ? (this may help to encourage that start of building json schema's for the body)
Can we move this file to src/main/resources ? I consider this more as part of the rest-api-spec then meta-data of the project/build.
